title: Fix #1410 - add selection.interrupt.
body: This also changes the imports so that it’s possible to build a version of D3 with selections but without transitions.

title: MSPointerDown & MSGestureChange for zoom behavior.
body:
Fix for [#1438](https://github.com/mbostock/d3/issues/1439#issuecomment-22189678) issue.
I'm not sure that I've made absolutely d3-way changes, but it works and does not affect any other functionality/device.

title: Fix #1437 - add identity projection.
body: The identity projection is equivalent to setting path.projection(null), except that you can apply post-projection features such as viewport clipping.

title: Update bar-2.markdown
body: It's the x-axis that's being added with this step, not the y.

title: Update d3.js
body:
addEventListener not supported by ie8 

disregard line 9...

title: Optimized array.js
body: Optimization @mbostock chose from the `pull request` [1423](https://github.com/mbostock/d3/pull/1423)

title: Optimized set.js
body: Optimization @mbostock chose from the `pull request` [1423](https://github.com/mbostock/d3/pull/1423)

title: add beforesend event to xhr. fixes #1397
Optimizations
body: See commit information.

title: Fix #1420 - regression with degenerate log ticks.
body: Commit 59554738 broke the check for a degenerate domain; this restores the original check and adds a test to verify this behavior.

title: Avoid binding multiple touch listeners for zoom.
body:
For a two-finger pinch, if two touchstart events fire, this results in
two touchmove and touchend listeners.  The first will have a single
location in the locations variable, but its touchmove listener will
fire with two touches, causing it to fail due to not finding the
location of the second touch.

If the first listener fires before the second, this exception breaks
touch zooming (as no further listeners will be called), but the order is
undefined so may be browser/device dependent (for reproducing the bug).

Since zooming only ever involves a single gesture at a time, it makes
more sense to only have one listener of each type at a time, unlike
dragging, which involves multiple drag gestures at once.

title: Fix #1407 - transition.filter crashes on empty.
body: Also remove unneeded third argument to d3_transition since transition.time is now stored on the per-node transition object.

title: Remove mouse listeners from intended target.
Fix #1402 - transition callback order.
body: Rather than registering new timers, reassign the transition’s timer callback in-place such that the order of callbacks for transitions is always prioritized based on when the transition was created.

title: Fix panning for native Android 4.1 browser.
body:
This particular browser appears to fire a mousemove event as well as the
usual touch events.

The zoom behaviour adds a mousemove listener to reset translate0 to null
(so that scrolling the mouse wheel records a new translate0 vector).
However, the translate0 variable is also used to record initial touch
vectors on touchstart.

The fix uses a different variable to record initial touch vectors, since
in theory it might be possible to fire mousewheel events and touch
events simultaneously.

title: Remove symmetric Math.log.
body: Since Math.log is a monotonic function for positive values, we can safely remove the Math.log from both sides of the comparison. The reason Math.log was used previously is that this is an estimate of error (the log difference between the desired number of ticks and the actual number of ticks).

title: Suggested modification to selection.data
Use d3.rgb for categorical scales.
body: Now that d3.interpolateRgb (and by extension, d3.scale.linear) returns color instances for color interpolation, it seems more consistent to use d3.rgb for categorical scales, as well.

title: rgb.brighter 0 values not being incremented.
body: When any of the rgb values are 0 the if statement will be false and the value wont be incremented.

title: Fix #1373 - suppress touchstart on drag.
body:
This is not ideal because it disables clicking on draggable links, but as we are forced to suppress the touchstart event (before any movement) in order to disable touch-to-drag or pinch-to-zoom, I think this is the only option. Or, we might dispatch a synthetic click event if the touchstart is prevented.

This pull request also fixes the bug where touchend in d3.behavior.zoom calls touchstart, which was causing two quick touchend events to be misinterpreted as a dbltap.

title: Preserve user provided extent when resizing
body:
Currently, if a brush is created or updated with a user provided extent, all extent values may be modified even if only a single drag handle is adjusted.  This makes it difficult to use the returned brush extent when the initially set values are significant (e.g. if a brush is used as a time slider and the user adjusts the end time, we don't expect the start time to change).

Instead of clearing the entire cached extent any time one of the brush edges is moved, only the modified value should be cleared from the cached extent.  Then when getting a new extent, only the required values should be recalculated.

This example demonstrates the issue: http://bl.ocks.org/tschaub/5962208

title: Remove redundant Sizzle.uniqueSort call
body: Sizzle always returns unique elements in document order. If it doesn't, that is a bug that should be reported to Sizzle.

title: Fix axis for scales that don’t define ticks.
body:
In addition to ordinal scales, quantile, quantize and threshold scales don’t define a ticks method. Unlike ordinal scales, however, these quantitative scales also don’t define a rangeBand method, so the axis was crashing trying to render these scales. This fixes #1367 by checking for the required rangeBand method rather than assuming scales without a ticks method define a rangeBand.

Note, however, that even with this change you probably still want to define tick values explicitly when using one of these scales with an axis. That’s because each tick in the axis represents a span of values in the domain; you can use the invertExtent method to get the span for each tick value.
